com.decoded.zool

Class ZoolServiceMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.decoded.zool.ZoolServiceMesh

  • public class ZoolServiceMesh
extends java.lang.Object
    This class wraps Zool and interacts with it as a Service announcement portal. Each Application Container that uses a ZoolServiceMesh can define a service key for every container with the same service. Each container will be grouped into a list of hosts for that service key. Each host on the Zool Cluster will get a copy of the entire services map. This is how each host knows about all other services, and their locations inherently.

    Zool Service Mesh will periodically run cleaning services (e.g. when new hosts / services are announced or removed) which pings the health check endpoint of all known hosts. Any non-responsive hosts are removed from the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceToken

        public static byte[] getInstanceToken(java.lang.String hostUri)
        Generates an instance token for a host uri, and base64 encodes it. A new token value is generated each minute.
        Parameters:
        hostUri - the host uri, e.g. "localhost:9000"
        Returns:
        a byte[] for the new token generated.

      • getNextHostFromHostList

        public static java.lang.String getNextHostFromHostList(java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong hostIdxHolder,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> hosts)
        This method returns the next host in a list of hosts, based ont he atomic index for that sent of hosts. in this case it is naive, and the index is incremented and modulus operator is applied.
        Parameters:
        hostIdxHolder - the atomic index
        hosts - the set of hosts
        Returns:
        the chosen host or empty

      • getDiscoveryHealthCheckEndpoint

        public java.lang.String getDiscoveryHealthCheckEndpoint()
        The endpoint that we'll use for discovery healthcheck. This is the URI that Zool will use to ping hosts that have announced on a cluster.
        Returns:
        a string, the endpoint uri, e.g. /healthCheck

        Returns:
        this ZoolServiceMesh

        hostUri - the host uri
        Returns:
        a ZoolAnnouncement

      • suppressServiceHost

        public boolean suppressServiceHost(java.lang.String serviceKey,
                                   java.lang.String hostUri,
                                   byte[] token)
        Suppress a service host that has been announced. Must match the current token.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey - the service key
        hostUri - the host
        token - the token
        Returns:
        true if the suppression was successful.

        hostUri - the host uri
        Returns:

        existingToken - an existing token (e.g. if it was staged)
        Returns:
        the ZoolAnnouncement

      • suppressServiceHost

        public boolean suppressServiceHost(java.lang.String serviceKey,
                                   java.lang.String hostUri,
                                   java.lang.String incomingToken)
        Suppresses a service host, removing it from the mesh network. This should only be called remotely by clients if they are shutdown gracefully.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey - the service key
        hostUri - the host
        incomingToken - the incoming token
        Returns:
        true if the suppression was successful.
